Summary: Clear day, no clouds,witnessed by 2 people, metalic and close up.clearly seen
divs: sighting detailsi am a 43 yr old truck driver, local route for over 20 years. i live a half mile from a commercial\civilian airport and 2 miles from weeler sack airport, a military base, home of the 10th muntain division on fort drum n.y., so i regularly scan the skies identifying everything from c10 military planes to small piper cub personal craft as a hobby over the last decade while i work and when driving for personal reasons. while i made detailed sketches and wrote down every detail that day, i am a bit scared to pull up the documentation, so i am only giving you my memory at this time. i was driving back from work on a afternoon as clear as it could be, sunshine, and not a cloud in the sky. as i drove i noticed a metalic craft "maybe more crome looking i feel" shaped like a arrow head but with softer edges, "kind of almond like". it entered my view from the left of my rig window, "it was heading northbound while i was heading westbound. the craft was close enough to make out every detail as it continued a slow movement northward about three hundred feet above ground and about 4 to 8 hundred feet away depending on its size, "i couldn't tell for sure", but i estimate 15 - 30 ft. it made no sound. i was speachless trying to figure out what it was as it continued its course and began to teeter side to side and flash in the sun. i could very clearly see there were no visable doors or window, as thou it had been entirly dipped in crome. as the object continued to "play" and flash in the sun, it leaned sideways just enough to the right to reflect the sunshine into the cab like a mirror, attracting the attention of my co-worker. he yelled "what the hell is that!". i pulled over the truck a bit shaken and we got out. "i had never believed in u.f.o's before this event at age 40!" we watched for another few minute, just repeating the same phrase, "what the hell is that!" suddenly it was gone in a blink of the eye. i got myself together and went home to tell my family. my brother in law, "a captian at fort drum" told me the military would hound my and everyone would think i was nuts if i told my story, but now i am retired and have to get it off my chest. thanks, bob if you wish, you can contact me at gould7@yahoo.com i would be happy to go into more detail if you care to hear it, or i could dig out my notes and sketches from that day, scan them and e-mail them to you so you have the exact date, time and fresh memory notes.
